parameters.name: filter[regionCode]
parameters.description: You can download consolidated or separate financial reports per territory. For a complete list of possible values, see Financial Report Regions and Currencies.

parameters.name: filter[reportDate]
parameters.description: The date of the report you wish to download based on the Apple Fiscal Calendar. The date is specified in the YYYY-MM format.

parameters.name: filter[vendorNumber]
parameters.description: You can find your vendor number in Payments and Financial Reports.

get.summary: Download Finance Reports
get.description: Download finance reports filtered by your specified criteria.

parameters.name: filter[reportDate]
parameters.description: The date of the report you wish to download based on the Apple Fiscal Calendar. The date is specified in the YYYY-MM format.

parameters.name: filter[reportType]
parameters.description: The report to download. For more details on each report type see About Reports.

parameters.name: filter[vendorNumber]
parameters.description: You can find your vendor number in Payments and Financial Reports.

parameters.name: filter[frequency]
parameters.description: Frequency of the report to download.

parameters.name: filter[reportSubType]
parameters.description: The report sub type to download.

parameters.name: filter[version]
parameters.description: The version of the report.

get.summary: Download Sales and Trends Reports
get.description: Download sales and trends reports filtered by your specified criteria.

Error.description: The details about one error that is returned when an API request is not successful.

code.description: A machine-readable code indicating the type of error. The code is a hierarchical value with levels of specificity separated by the '.' character. This value is parseable for programmatic error handling in code.

status.description: The HTTP status code of the error. This status code usually matches the response's status code; however, if the request produces multiple errors, these two codes may differ.

id.description: The unique ID of a specific instance of an error, request, and response. Use this ID when providing feedback to or debugging issues with Apple.

title.description: A summary of the error. Do not use this field for programmatic error handling.

detail.description: A detailed explanation of the error. Do not use this field for programmatic error handling.

source.description: One of two possible types of values: source.parameter, provided when a query parameter produced the error, or source.JsonPointer, provided when a problem with the entity produced the error.

ErrorResponse.description: Detailed error information returned in the response body whenever an API request is not successful.

errors.description: An array of one or more errors.

UsersResponse.description: A response containing a list of resources.

links.description: Navigational links that include the self-link.

PagedDocumentLinks.description: Links related to the response document, including paging links.

first.description: The link to the first page of documents.

next.description: The link to the next page of documents.

self.description: The link that produced the current document.

Paging.description: Paging details such as the total number of resources and the per-page limit.

total.description: The total number of resources matching your request.

limit.description: The maximum number of resources to return per page, from 0 to 200.

id.description: The opaque resource ID that uniquely identifies the resource.

id.description: The opaque resource ID that uniquely identifies the resource.

links.description: Navigational links that include the self-link.

provisioningAllowed.description: A Boolean value that indicates the user's specified role allows access to the provisioning functionality on the Apple Developer website.

allAppsVisible.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether a user has access to all apps available to the team.

roles.description: Assigned user roles that determine the user's access to sections of App Store Connect and tasks they can perform.

UserRole.description: Strings representing user roles in App Store Connect.

id.description: The opaque resource ID that uniquely identifies the resource.

App.description: The data structure that represents the resource.

bundleId.description: The bundle ID for your app. This ID must match the one you use in Xcode. The bundle ID cannot be changed after you upload your first build.

name.description: The name of your app as it will appear in the App Store. The maximum length is 30 characters.

primaryLocale.description: The primary locale for your app. If localized app information isnâ€™t available in an App Store territory, the information from your primary language is used instead.

sku.description: A unique ID for your app that is not visible on the App Store.

UserInvitation.description: The data structure that represents the resource.

relationships.description: Navigational links to related data and included resource types and IDs.

email.description: The email address of a pending user invitation. The email address must be valid to activate the account. It can be any email address, not necessarily one associated with an Apple ID.

firstName.description: The first name of the user with the pending user invitation.

lastName.description: The last name of the user with the pending user invitation.

roles.description: Assigned user roles that determine the user's access to sections of App Store Connect and tasks they can perform.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the pending invitation.

provisioningAllowed.description: A Boolean value that indicates the user's specified role allows access to the provisioning functionality on the Apple Developer website.

allAppsVisible.description: A Boolean value that indicates whether a user has access to all apps available to the team.

http-security.description: Authentication for the App Store Connect API involved obtaining a signed JWT for each request. For more information on the authentication process, see the App Store Connect API Documentation.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
Manage users on your App Store Connect team.

The users resource represents an App Store Connect user. You can change or delete users, but you cannot add them directly. To add users, create a userInvitation. App Store Connect adds the user to your team when they accept the invitation.

tags.name: User Invitations
tags.description:
Email invitations for joining your App Store Connect team.

The userInvitations resource represents users who have been invited to join a team in App Store Connect. When you create a user invitation the user receives an email with a link to activate an account and connect it to their Apple ID.

If the user accepts the invitation, the user is added to the team and the invitation is deleted. User invitations expire after three days.

You can also get a list of all invited users, read the invite information of a single user, and find out which apps an invited user can test.

tags.name: Bundle IDs
tags.description:
Manage the bundle IDs that uniquely identify your apps.

The bundleIds resource represents the app's unique identifier that you can register, modify, and delete. You need a bundle ID before you can assign capabilities with the Bundle ID Capabilities resource or create a provisioning profile with the Profiles resource.

tags.name: Certificates
tags.description:
Create, download, and revoke signing certificates for app development and distribution.

The certificates resource represents the digital certificates you use to sign your iOS or Mac apps for development and distribution. You can create new certificates, revoke existing certificates, and download certificates.

tags.name: Devices
tags.description:
Register devices for development and testing.

A devices resource represents the iOS, Apple TV, Apple Watch, and Mac devices that you register to use for development and testing. You can register a limited number of new devices and get information about them.

tags.name: Profiles
tags.description:
Create, delete, and download provisioning profiles that enable app installations for development and distribution.

The profiles resource represents the provisioning profiles that allow you to install apps on your iOS devices or Mac. You can create and delete provisioning profiles, and download them to sign your code.
Provisioning profiles include signing certificates, device identifiers, and a bundle ID.

tags.name: Sales and Finance Reports
tags.description: Download your sales and financial reports. App Store Connect provides data that allows you to measure the performance of your app and view payments from Apple. Use the App Store Connect API to apply filters to select and configure the data, and automate the download of sales and financial reports. For detailed information on reports, see Analytics and reporting overview.
